name: Research Opportunity Program
description: This course provides a rewarding opportunity for students in their fourth year to undertake relatively advanced work in the research project of a professor in return for SOC499Y5 course credit. Participating faculty members post their project descriptions for the following summer and fall/winter sessions in early February and students are invited to apply in early March. See Experiential and International Opportunities for more details.
prerequisites: SOC221H5, SOC222H5, completed at least 13.0 credits, P.I.
